summary: This document is a chain of emails from September 2019 between U.S. Department of Justice officials, including an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York and a DOJ Attaché at the U.S. Embassy in Paris. The emails discuss coordinating a call to share information about the Jeffrey Epstein investigation with the Paris prosecutor's office, which is preparing to execute search warrants.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The primary SDNY prosecutor corresponding with the DOJ Attaché in Paris about sharing information on the Epstein case with French authorities. They are part of the team investigating Epstein and his co-conspirators.

persons.name: DOJ Attache/Magistrat de liaison americain U.S. Embassy, Paris
persons.role: DOJ Attaché at the U.S. Embassy in Paris
persons.context: The official at the U.S. Embassy in Paris who is liaising between the SDNY prosecutors and the Paris prosecutor's office regarding the French investigation into Epstein's potential connections to France.

connections.person1: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.person2: DOJ Attache/Magistrat de liaison americain U.S. Embassy, Paris
connections.description: Colleagues within the U.S. Department of Justice coordinating on international aspects of the Epstein investigation, specifically regarding information sharing with French authorities.

connections.person1: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: Described as being part of the same SDNY team handling the investigation into Epstein and his co-conspirators.

events.title: Coordination call scheduled between SDNY and DOJ Paris
events.description: Email exchange to schedule a call between SDNY prosecutors and the DOJ Attaché in Paris to discuss sharing information about the Epstein investigation with the Paris prosecutor's office.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
DOJ Attache/Magistrat de liaison americain U.S. Embassy, Paris

events.title: Follow-up call with Paris prosecutor's office
events.description: The DOJ Attaché in Paris had a follow-up call with the Paris prosecutor's office about their Epstein investigation, discussing confidentiality and upcoming search warrants.
personsInvolved: DOJ Attache/Magistrat de liaison americain U.S. Embassy, Paris

events.title: Call scheduled with Paris prosecutor's office on confidentiality
events.description: The DOJ Attaché scheduled a call with the Paris prosecutor's office to discuss the confidentiality of any information the U.S. might share regarding the Epstein case.
personsInvolved: DOJ Attache/Magistrat de liaison americain U.S. Embassy, Paris

events.title: Initial inquiry about connecting with SDNY Epstein team
events.description: The DOJ Attaché in Paris emailed a colleague to request connection with the SDNY prosecutors working on the Epstein investigation, following an inquiry from the Paris prosecutor's office.
personsInvolved: DOJ Attache/Magistrat de liaison americain U.S. Embassy, Paris
Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The Paris prosecutor's office was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's potential connections to France as of September 2019.
The Paris prosecutor's office was preparing to execute search warrants, possibly as early as the week of September 9, 2019.
U.S. authorities (SDNY and DOJ Paris) were coordinating to share information with French investigators, with discussions about the confidentiality of such shared information.
The French investigation was described as 'ramping up' and was seen as potentially obtaining information helpful to the U.S. case against Epstein.
The correspondence shows direct, high-level coordination between U.S. and French law enforcement regarding the Epstein investigation shortly after his death.
